page.title: 01Summary
page.content: Our block slopes from west to east. Some parts are hilly and the rest is flat. The highest point of our block is about 350 feet above sea level. The lowest part is the beach. In the north of the block is the town of{Tayport.}Most houses are very old and it is a residential town which faces north over the river Tay, and was an important Ferry port before the Tay bridge was built. The population is approx' 3240. Our block has five farms, Scotscraig, Morton, Shanwell, Garpit and Kirkton barns.It has both pasture and arable but mostly arable. About half the block is fields. Our block has a big forest called Tentsmuir, which has a nature reserve, and lochs for ducks and wildfowl.
